title: 2-Year-Old Killed in Little Rock Shooting
content:
LITTLE ROCK, AR.-- - (via KARK) -- A 2-year-old child died after gunshots were fired at a car on the city's south side.
Around 8:30 p.m. Tuesday, Little Rock Police officers received a call from UAMS saying they were treating a two-year-old for gunshot wounds.
The child was reportedly in the car with her 27-year-old mother, the mother's 37-year-old cousin, and four other children when an unknown car drove by and fired shots at them.
The mother's cousin, who was driving the car, said that she and the child's mother were driving toward Van Buren St. when they turned a corner and heard several gunshots as a car drove by.
The child's mother said she was in the back seat of the car, holding her daughter, at the time of the incident. When she realized her daughter had been shot, she drove her to the hospital.
The child died in the emergency room from her injuries shortly after 9 p.m.
Police say no one involved in the incident saw a suspect.
Officers were able to pinpoint the area of the shooting as the 2000 block of S. Harrison St., near the crossing of Charles Bussey and Harrison.
Officers said they found several empty shell casings in that area.
Police say the motive of the shooting is unknown.
